feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle does not properly restrict access to category and course data
entry.content:
The file_browser component in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.5 and 2.1.x before 2.1.2 does not properly restrict access to category and course data, which allows remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive information via a request for a file.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4300
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=747444
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=f6b07c4da54a9db24723beb147e8a19a3d487e00
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=188311
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=f6b07c4da54a9db24723beb147e8a19a3d487e00
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/6f7c43c7de8f62cd53a7f3b54ad5325cd109c1be
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/81c77993e3808bba68fe24d6bfbac19a41679a6f
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/f6b07c4da54a9db24723beb147e8a19a3d487e00
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9p54-pc88-36c4

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Double-Caches Content, Potentially Writing to a File System's Tmp Directory
entry.content:
The theme implementation in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.4 and 2.1.x before 2.1.1 triggers duplicate caching of Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and JavaScript content, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions and write to an operating-system temporary directory via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4293
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=e1c2a211f259821910be2cba23679d4176fb00a3
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=182736
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/05f4555422278190ec24a88466ac43c914a7e5d6
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/9a380fbb53429713b3c422a3146456dc97205329
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/e1c2a211f259821910be2cba23679d4176fb00a3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wxvp-8q8h-r6rr

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in course/editsection.html in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.14 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted data.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4306
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=747444
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=4a2acd8c7e6c869d5fd5aa686e6e0a3f20c97f15
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=188319
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=4a2acd8c7e6c869d5fd5aa686e6e0a3f20c97f15
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/4a2acd8c7e6c869d5fd5aa686e6e0a3f20c97f15
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r729-mx2r-j26j

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Allows Modification of Constants
entry.content:
The MoodleQuickForm class in the Forms Library in lib/formslib.php in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.14, 2.0.x before 2.0.5, and 2.1.x before 2.1.2 does not recognize Forms API setConstant operations, which allows remote attackers to submit unexpected form content by modifying the values of constant fields.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4301
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=747444
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=f1f70bd4dde6cd1ea4bdb8ab28fa3d36a53b89d8
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=188313
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=f1f70bd4dde6cd1ea4bdb8ab28fa3d36a53b89d8
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/1f52e72526c305989eadc702b5299edb2a50ac3c
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/2a44c5192c875c4f4b4e813d7227b19d8fda86ba
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/a6f18c98f43b6fc6b8b7c4e96af41cb4a626e1b8
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/f1f70bd4dde6cd1ea4bdb8ab28fa3d36a53b89d8
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jcrj-gmr6-p5j8

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Allows Modification of Constants
entry.content:
The MoodleQuickForm class in the Forms Library in lib/formslib.php in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.14, 2.0.x before 2.0.5, and 2.1.x before 2.1.2 does not recognize Forms API setConstant operations, which allows remote attackers to submit unexpected form content by modifying the values of constant fields.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4301
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=747444
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=f1f70bd4dde6cd1ea4bdb8ab28fa3d36a53b89d8

  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/a6f18c98f43b6fc6b8b7c4e96af41cb4a626e1b8
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/f1f70bd4dde6cd1ea4bdb8ab28fa3d36a53b89d8
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jcrj-gmr6-p5j8

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS In Tag Autocomplete functionality
entry.content:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the tag autocomplete functionality in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.11 and 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4278
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=fd29b2ad1c20906da00d7e523f39bc8a0358a65b
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=170003
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/34b93e39a64a68e4a676b93ccf2bd87a1d3b5ef8
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/fd29b2ad1c20906da00d7e523f39bc8a0358a65b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6656-6qwx-4c2m

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Open Redirect Via Error Messages
entry.content:
The error-message functionality in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.13, 2.0.x before 2.0.4, and 2.1.x before 2.1.1 does not ensure that a continuation link refers to an http or https URL for the local Moodle instance, which might allow attackers to trick users into visiting arbitrary web sites via error message links that lead offsite.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4294
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=8f9f666c902cb30ef6f519353f38c45a29fdf4a6
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=182737
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/18c2fcf8f19e00f0e89421d8fd8b7486a6dc6f79
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/417fdfab6bbdcfc3f5b64704ec06912ae9cd1050
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/8f9f666c902cb30ef6f519353f38c45a29fdf4a6
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hxmp-8f47-x9fc

entry.title: [neos/media-browser] Neos CMS Cross Site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Neos CMS 8.3.3 allows a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SVG file uploaded to the neos/management/media component. To make use of this attack vector, the attacker must either be able to upload a maliciously crafted file or coerce someone with the needed access to upload said file to Neos. Even if such a file is uploaded and subsequently delivered, it is possible to use CSP to protect against attacks being executed from such a file.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-37611
  • https://rodelllemit.medium.com/stored-xss-in-neo-cms-8-3-3-9bd1cb973c5b
  • https://github.com/neos/neos-ui/releases/tag/8.3.4
  • https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet.html
  • https://digi.ninja/blog/svg_xss.php
  • https://github.com/neos/neos-development-collection/issues/4833
  • https://github.com/neos/neos-development-collection/pull/4812
  • https://github.com/neos/neos-development-collection/commit/4ac0df04d2e44e164e95887b466075dde3f04045
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6qjf-7g3j-qx25

entry.title: [ec-cube/ec-cube] EC-CUBE XSS Vulnerabilities
entry.content:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in (1) data/Smarty/templates/default/list.tpl and (2) data/Smarty/templates/default/campaign/bloc/cart_tag.tpl in EC-CUBE before 2.4.4 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-0451
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/65079
  • http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN84393059/index.html
  • http://jvndb.jvn.jp/en/contents/2011/JVNDB-2011-000011.html
  • http://svn.ec-cube.net/open_trac/changeset/18742
  • http://www.ec-cube.net/info/weakness/weakness.php?id=36
  • https://github.com/EC-CUBE/ec-cube/commit/8ef6541fc66b86d40a4333ec1608be3191c5e463
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200229005109/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/46100
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wgvv-5396-ggvj

entry.title: [baserproject/basercms] BaserCMS privilege escallation
entry.content:
BaserCMS before 1.6.12 does not properly restrict additions to the membership of the operators group, which allows remote authenticated users to gain privileges via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-2674
  • http://basercms.net/patch/JVN09789751
  • http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN16617002/index.html
  • http://jvndb.jvn.jp/jvndb/JVNDB-2011-000066
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6wr6-54mw-mvhr
